DataElement.preferredDefinition: Sex of the subject as determined by the investigator.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to demographics._The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to demographics.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to demographics.

Property.preferredDefinition: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2021-6-8 ak Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA.  3/21/19 released/reuse by NRDS; tmt. 8-24-18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task/tt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Sex of Individual Terminology Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Sex of Individual within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person (one of unisexual specimens) who is born with genitalia and/or secondary sexual characteristics of indeterminate sex, or which combine features of both sexes.

Concepts.definition: A person (one of unisexual specimens) who is born with genitalia and/or secondary sexual characteristics of indeterminate sex, or which combine features of both sexes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Sex of Individual Terminology Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. (NCI):A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the appropriate sex (e.g., F (female), M (male).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Collect the subject's sex or gender, as reported by subject or caretaker. This is a phenotypic assessment and not a genotypic assessment.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.
